description: {"blocks":[{"key":"add5i","text":"We have developed PotatoMASH (Potato Multi-Allele Scanning Haplotags), a novel low cost, genome-scanning marker platform. We designed a panel of 339 multi-allelic regions placed at 1 Mb intervals throughout the euchromatic portion of the genome. These regions were assayed using a multiplex amplicon sequencing approach, which allows to genotype hundreds of plants at a cost of €5/sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1rq63","text":"This protocol describes the library construction part of the method. PotatoMASH libraries are made to be sequenced in Illumina sequencing platforms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1rud0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Organize your samples in 96 well plates, quantitate template DNA, and normalize at 20ng/uL.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8h83c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4e1rh","text":"Quantification with PicoGreen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"da46r","text":"In the preparation for the library construction, the first step is to quantify the template DNA. We used Quant-iT™ PicoGreen ® dsDNA assay kit (Invitrogen, P7589)as detailed below: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bjhm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1e91q","text":"The Quant-iT™  PicoGreen kit should be stored in   in the dark. An hour before take the PicoGreen kit out from the fridge and place in room temp, protect the PicoGreen reagent from light by covering the tube with aluminium foil. The Lambda DNA standard should be always kept in 4°C. {"blocks":[{"key":"efs0t","text":"This step is optional. By having normalized the template genomic DNA prior to PCR, we minimized the differences of efficiency in each PCR. Homogeneous template DNA quality also minimizes differences in PCR yield in each well. However, if you are genotyping sets of DNA extracts within the same plate of very variable quality, we recommend to follow the complete protocol including library normalization step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqqha","text":"When performing this step be aware to have followed step 2.4A and proceed at later stage with step 6.2A.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ju3f","text":"When skipping this step be aware to have followed step 2.4B and proceed at later stage with step 6.2B.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":97,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b1sqa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4a2n2","text":"In this step we normalize the PCR2 product in each well down to ∼25 ng in 20 µL (∼1.25ng/µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"599vd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"30gam","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eufap","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eonp8","text":"As an additional benefit, it also provides with a first purification step: the binding buffer provides low pH condition causing the positive surface charge of coating of the library normalization plates to bind the negatively charged nucleic acid backbone. Proteins and other contaminants (such as short oligonucleotide primers) are not bound and are simply washed away.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aphmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f7d8i","text":"Tip: In this step, it is possible to use unfiltered tips, since the libraries are already prepared and barcoded, therefore, the risk of contamination is lower.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":159}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aq959","text":"It is advised to read the manufacturer's protocol (Applied Biosystems, A105100)   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7c87a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AAB574A0290411ED845017F70C3A7AF3","height":74.43037974683544,"id":362311,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mb4jbnm8f.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mb4hbnm8f.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/mb4ibnm8f.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mb4gbnm8f.webp","width":202.75862068965517}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"7B026D2027D411ED8D7EBFC58A24426B","id":287174,"original_name":"sequalprep_platekit_man.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/i2qgbnm8f.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6svsa","text":"This step is meant to remove PCR1 primer-dimer amplified products in PCR2 and other unwanted secondary products from the PotatoMASH libraries. {"blocks":[{"key":"1j58g","text":"Prepare 1.2 % standard low melting point agarose gel in 0.5x TBE (TAE buffer can be also used).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":41,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ctj1","text":"For DNA visualization, we use GelRed dye applied to the agarose gel before polymerizing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"emhjm","text":"Make sure the wells of the gel are wide-deep enough to hold 48 µL of sample. That can be achieved, for example, by covering three 7 mm. wide x 1mm thick comb teeth (3 wells) with scotch tape to make a wider well of 2.5 cm x 1mm thick. We recommend to leave one normal size well empty between different pools.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2g8s5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c09j8","text":"Tip: Around 200mL of agarose are used for a gel 14cm long and 23 cm wide 7mm thick to get the wells deep enough to hold 48 µL. steps.section: Sub-libraries quantitation and final pooling into a single library
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7mc2d","text":"Quantitation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aubr8","text":"Sub-libraries quantitation using Qubit™ dsDNA BR Assay Kit (Thermofisher Q32853) following manufacturer's guidelines   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9iugm","text":"Given the expected yield, we recommend to use 3-5 µL of each sub-library to quantify them with the Broad spectrum assay kit. Alternatively, The HS (high sensitivity) assay kit can be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6erko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"14hl9","text":"Pooling sub-libraries into a single library:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fhirn","text":"Calculate the volume from each sub-library to be pooled so there is the same amount in ng of each sub-library in the volume of the final library. Pool the sub-libraries and mix by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"54o7d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"26bns","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"76e0p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ltqq","text":"Make sure that your final PotatoMASH library meets the sample requirements for Illumina sequencing of pre-made libraries (PCR free library), which usually are \u003e0.5-1ng/ µL (quantified by Qubit), \u003e20 µL or more volume depending of the amount of sequencing data required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ejek","text":"Sequencing service companies usually offer demultiplexing of libraries and for that the ask the barcode of each sublibrary. Here is an example of how to code the sublibraries:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2a48m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"222rh","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"71tnf","text":"You can also demultiplex the data yourself and you will need the i5 and i7 barcodes of each sample. The tags are written in the name of each primer, but here you have them in a table:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bkae8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"25p4a","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"767s7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bdhfv","text":"This method has successfully genotyped 765 samples in a whole lane of  Illumina HiseqX platform using 50% PhiX, obtaining paired-end 150nt reads (56Gb of data). {"blocks":[{"key":"caugk","text":"Library quality check (optional) by 'Illumina PCR' (PCR with known primers which anneal to Illumina capture adapters P5 and P7).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ocak","text":"This is an alternative method to check the quality of your libraries without the need to use bioanalyzer or fragment analyzer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9q4dh","text":"It can be performed only on the Final library or to the sub-libraries before pooling them, in case you would prefer to further purify one of them before pooling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f6slj","text":"The primers will anneal to any PCR product containing P5 and P7, so you can detect if you still have too many small fragments in your sub-libraries or final library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c1f2e","text":"Before starting:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7nldv","text":"Order the primers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3t3q8","text":"P5 primer: 5'-AAT GAT ACG GCG ACC ACC GA-3'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7chev","text":"P7 primer: 5'-CAA GCA GAA GAC GGC ATA CGA-3'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
